original: ﻿ Corridor or apartment, which is best? In May last year I moved into a student-corridor in Flogsta here in Uppsala after having lived in an apartment for about four months. It was quite a big apartment and I had shared it with a friend.

obfuscation: I was used tto having a big kitchen. A big living-room for just the two inside us,; and the opportunity tto invite lots; in friends. Living inside corridor meant big changes for me.

obfuscation: Now I have lived there for one year, also ny now I know this myself actually prefer to living like that.
original: Now I've lived there for almost a year, and ny now I know that I actually prefer to live like this.

obfuscation: Of course, I would probably study further asumming that myself was n't tempted tto spend so much time in the cooking, but onthe other part, if myself felt sad. Lonely I would not get that much engage in either.

obfuscation: What could be an issue, though, be that persons with which you live know everything about you. They know when you leave also when you, come home,. In addition, Lf you; come home alone. In addition, There be much gossip in location, like this.
original: What could be a problem, though, is that the people with whom you live know everything about you. They know when you leave and when you come home, and if you come home alone. There is much gossip in a place like that.

obfuscation: Myself think veerybody ought tto try living that way, at some point in life. You learning lots about how, to obtain together with other people.
original: I think veerybody ought to try living this way at some time in their lives. You learn a lot about how to get along with other people.

original: Now I learn to take my responsibility in another way, for example, I have to clena the kitchen every time I've used it, I can't just leave my dirty plate in the sink, because I know how irritating it is when the others do that.

original: Another thing you learn is of course to share things, and that makes it even more important to wash the dirty saucepans and plates, since someone else will want to use them. The way I see it, this kind of living is very good.

obfuscation: But, I 've already mentioned the key arguments, but there are in course others as well. For instance, Asumming that you forget tto buy something there 's always somebody inside the hallway from whom you can borrow it.

original: I feel that I know quite well what I'm talking about when I say that everybody should live with other people like this for a period in their lives, because I've lived both in a corridor and in a shared apartment, and, before that, all by myself in a very small room when I studied in Paris.
